docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers exploring how a gene related to the chemical messenger dopamine affects behavior have stumbled on an unexpected role the gene appears to play in high blood pressure. The researchers, reporting their results in the current issue of The American Journal of Hypertension, say it appears that people who have a long form of the gene tend to have higher blood pressure. They are also more likely to have blood pressure that rises with age.

headline.main: Gene Seems to Be Related to High Blood Pressure

docs.snippet: The gene known as DRD4 seems to play an unexpected role in high blood pressure.
